entry.title: The dress
entry.summary:
Author: FirefighterConstellations

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,954Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 91

Summary: A simple stop at a boutique turns into a defining moment for the Diaz family. When Christopher finds a blue dress he loves, Ana’s discomfort clashes with Buck’s easy acceptance and Eddie’s fierce protectiveness. In the small space between laughter and judgment, Eddie realizes who truly sees his son — and who doesn’t. Buck doesn’t hesitate to stand up for Chris’s happiness, while Eddie finally draws the line with Ana. entry.title: What the Storm Left Behind
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,596Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: Buck only meant to duck out of the storm. Eddie only meant to get home in one piece. Neither planned on sharing a booth, a conversation, or the kind of instant connection that makes two strangers forget the rest of the world exists for a while. What starts as waiting out bad weather turns into something that sticks…late nights, easy routines, a baby who needs both of them, and a slow, undeniable pull toward each other that neither man is ready to name. Buck keeps showing up; Eddie keeps letting him. Somehow, that’s enough to change everything. This is how it began: the night they met, and the quiet, unexpected start of the family they were already becoming without realizing it.

entry.title: Things We Don't Say
entry.summary:
Author: Ifallinlovewithfictionalboys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 125,445Chapters: 19/23Kudos: 75

Summary: “What are you doing? You have to keep moving.”   “I never told you I’m from LA.”   Dr. Sol’s eyes widen, and he takes a step back.   “Howard–”   “Don’t.” He lets out an animaltic growl, “Don’t say anything unless it’s to explain what the hell is going on and why there is a Korean gang looking for me.”   “Mafia.” Dr. Sol corrects, “I don’t know what they want from you, I just know of them. Now please, you must go back to L.A. Your pack needs you.”  ---After seven months of being presumed dead, Buck comes back and finally reunites with his family.Now that he’s back, Buck makes it his mission to change things along the way. It’s easier than ever now that his pack knows the truth — or so he thought. Apparently, a supernatural world can make a world of a difference, and new threats are coming out of the shadows.It doesn’t help that he feels like he’s constantly forgetting something, or that Chimney is hiding secrets of his own.—PLEASE NOTE: This is part of a series, and will likely not make any sense as a stand alone.

entry.title: Only You
entry.summary:
Author: Tarlos_love23

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 483Chapters: 1/4Kudos: 5

Summary: Buck finally confesses to Eddie that he hooked up with his ex while Eddie was away, admitting it only happened once and meant nothing. Eddie is hurt and assumes Buck might still be in love with his ex, but Buck breaks down and insists that Eddie is the only person he wants. He reveals he kept the truth hidden because he was terrified of losing Eddie and being seen as untrustworthy. Eddie admits he thought Buck might have moved on to something better while he was gone. Buck reassures him that no one could ever replace him and that his heart has always been with Eddie. After hearing Buck’s confession of love, Eddie softens, realizing Buck truly wants him. The two share an emotional, intimate moment and agree to work through the pain together, choosing each other and deciding to move forward as a team.

entry.title: A Very Buddie Christmas
entry.summary:
Author: DianneRose2016

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,656Chapters: 5/24Kudos: 69

Summary: Firefighter Evan “Buck” Buckley has never needed a reason to show up for Eddie Diaz and his son Christopher. especially at Christmas. From tree shopping to gingerbread disasters, the three of them have their holiday traditions down to a science. But when Eddie’s relationship with Ana starts to strain under the weight of those traditions, Buck is forced to confront a truth he’s been trying to ignore: He doesn’t just love being part of their family. He loves them. As the countdown to Christmas ticks closer and tempers flare, Buck and Eddie must decide what, and who, makes a home feel like Christmas. And some wishes don’t fit under a tree… They’re found sitting beside you the whole time. A slow-burn Buddie holiday romance full of warmth, laughter, and the magic of choosing love.
